intro: Pyrenaria pahangensis, commonly known as the Pahang pyrenaria, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Malaysia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, where it thrives in the undergrowth. Its leaves are elliptical in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
